intro: Cyrtandra gagnei, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, berry-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra gagnei is considered a rare and endangered species.
